Art. 4.212. Seisin
The testator may give the executor seisin of all or only part of his movables. However, such seisin may not exceed one year and one day from the date of his death.
If he has not given it to him, the executor cannot demand it.
The heir may terminate the seisin by offering to remit to the executor a sum sufficient to pay the legacies of movable property, or by providing proof of such payment.
